title: Washing Creek Sand · Xiǎo Lín Er
card_title: Washing Creek Sand · Xiǎo Lín Er
card_excerpt: Swallows fly south in spring, apricots still small — must love always wait for the right moment?
zh:
春燕南飛春杏小，相愛何須相遇早，恰恰如今春未老。
我道真情君還笑，我笑君痴君心鬧。哈哈永遠與君好。
en:
Swallows fly south and the spring apricots are still small —
why must love wait for the perfect moment to begin?
Happily, spring is not yet old.
I speak of true feeling and you only smile;
I smile at your foolishness and your heart stirs with noise.
Ha — forever and always, I wish you well.

title: Fireworks
card_excerpt: Fireworks scatter upward in splendour, violet and crimson in a flash...
zh:
煙花散落升絢麗，霎時紫粉霎時紅。
原來情人意難斷，都付午夢煙火中。
en:
Fireworks burst upward in radiant splendour,
one moment violet, the next a blaze of red.
So this is how a lover's heart refuses to let go —
all of it surrendered to smoke and fire in an afternoon dream.

title: Parting
card_excerpt: Two hearts tethered across distant cities, a year of snow and separation...
zh:
異地兩處情難系，風雪一年各天涯。
而今難忘尋常日，君愛情濃我愛花。
en:
Love stretched thin across two distant cities,
a whole year of wind and snow, each at the edge of the world.
Now I cannot forget the ordinary days —
you so full of feeling, and I so full of flowers.

title: Reply to a Friend's Sky Photo from Tianshui
card_title: Reply to a Friend's Sky Photo
card_excerpt: Two crimson discs in the sky — impossible to tell dawn from dusk...
zh:
難辨天水兩輪赤，不知旭日或殘陽。
振臂高呼仍萬歲，走資走社各一方。
江山百代桑田變，共和光輝歲月長。
向使途殊歸者同，幾番變化又何妨？
en:
Two crimson discs hang in the sky of Tianshui —
impossible to say which is the rising sun and which the dying one.
Still we raise our arms and cry long live,
though the road to capital or commune forks sharply in two.
Mountains and rivers shift across a hundred generations;
the republic's light endures through all its long years.
If roads however different lead in the end to the same place,
what does it matter how many times the world turns over?

title: Winter Reverie
card_excerpt: The paulownia whispers low, as if calling dusk to come early...
zh:
梧桐盡低語，相約赴黃昏。
此期寒氣甚，尤可待來春。
en:
The paulownia trees murmur softly to one another,
making a quiet appointment to meet the dusk.
The cold bites deep this season —
all the more reason to wait for spring.

title: Partridge Sky · Zhè Gū Tiān
card_excerpt: How swiftly time flies — autumn ages before winter even arrives...
zh:
可憐時光太匆匆，始覚秋老又臨冬。
孤燈影落梧桐下，碎葉流浪北風中。
兩千裡，八刻鐘。靈犀一處兩心通。
翩翩雪落南方客，幸福門下再相擁。
en:
How pitifully swift the hours — barely noticing autumn age
before winter is already at the door.
A lone lamp casts its shadow beneath the paulownia;
broken leaves wander as vagrants in the north wind.
Two thousand li apart, yet only eight quarter-hours by train.
One shared thought — and two hearts speak without a single word.
Light as snowflakes falling on a southbound traveller,
we will embrace again at the doorway of happiness.

title: Night
card_excerpt: I drink as always, night after night revelling until the small hours...
zh:
我亦如常日日醉，夜夜達歡至凌晨。
功名利益休縛我，地籟天籟送青春。
en:
I drink as always, day after day lost in wine,
revelling every night until the small hours come.
Let fame and fortune leave me well alone —
the music of earth and sky will see my youth out.

title: Messenger in the Sky
card_excerpt: The road grows longer as the horse tires; rain quickens, shoulders heavy...
zh:
馬勞山更遠，雨急肩越沉。
天涯多倦客，牛馬荔枝人。
en:
The horse grows weary and the mountain recedes ever further;
the rain quickens its pace and the burden on the shoulder grows heavier.
The ends of the earth are full of exhausted travellers —
people who labour like oxen and horses just to carry lychees home.

title: Autumn
card_excerpt: The moon nears zenith and the mood soars — wild song, dance, wine...
zh:
月近中天興愈濃，狂歌醉舞佐金鐘。
小飲清釀我將醉，半關秋月半關風。
en:
As the moon nears its zenith the spirit swells ever higher,
wild song and drunken dance beside a golden cup.
A little clear wine and I am nearly gone —
half bewitched by the autumn moon, half carried away by the wind.

title: Untitled · On Writing
card_excerpt: Poetic material comes easily but praise is cheap — I am no genius...
zh:
詩材張口即菲頌，我非天才自雕琢。
夏秋冬春花雪月，聊摩雅致共爾說。
en:
Open your mouth for poetic material and hollow praise flows out with ease —
I am no genius; every line must be earned through patient carving.
Summer and autumn, winter and spring: flowers, snow, and the moon —
I polish them slowly, and share whatever small refinement I reach with you.

title: Farewell in Vernacular
card_excerpt: The station swells with passing strangers; outside, endless evening light...
zh:
站裡熙熙過客，街外無限夕陽。
回首過去三十日，心裡多少憂傷。
今日匆匆離去，春秋何其漫長。
動若參商難相聚，無奈又能何妨。
en:
The station hums with strangers passing through;
outside, the sunset stretches without end.
Looking back across these thirty days —
how much sorrow can a single heart hold?
Today we part in haste,
and the seasons stretching ahead seem impossibly long.
We move apart like Orion and Antares, rarely to meet —
and yet, what is there to be done?

title: After the Results
card_excerpt: A forest bird shatters the morning dream; dread deep as the ocean...
zh:
林鳥驚晨夢，憂心似海深。
夢醒知無奈，獨向天色新。
en:
A forest bird shatters the morning dream;
dread settles in, as deep and still as the ocean floor.
Waking, I know there is nothing to be done —
alone I turn and face the new light breaking in the sky.
